content.description: For the slab addict that can't get enough, this top-rope variation from the common anchor starts on the right side of the slab and climbs through mossy edges.  It gets seepy after a big rain.
content.protection: Top rope from the common ring/chain anchor.
content.location: It is on the right side of the diamond-shaped slab.

content.description: This is on the left side of the slab.  Start trending up and left past a few thin moves, clip a bolt, then follow a cool seam up and right to the top of the slab.
content.protection: A set of cams from small Aliens to #2 Camalot, 2 bolts, and a ring and chain rap anchor (or walk off).
content.location: It is on the left side of the diamond-shaped slab.

content.description: As the name suggests, this is the plumb line from the top of the slab.  Thin moves past two bolts eases to more edgy climbing.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus a couple of small wires and Aliens (or run it out) to a ring and chain anchor.
content.location: This ascends dead center of the diamond-shaped slab.  Rap, lower, or walk off.
